subject: Re: [junit] Using a custom classloader to facilitate testing
msgSnippet: ... Can t say I ve done that, but I have used a custom class loader to flush classes under test.  Specifically, one app I m involved with instruments Java byte
messageBody:
Shez wrote:

>Hi guys.
> I was wondering if anyone has ever investigated the possibility of using a
>custom classloader to transparantly (to the tested code) provide non standard
>implementations of collaberating classes without having to provide
>constructors or setters to specify an implementation of every type used in a
>class.
>

Can't say I've done that, but I have used a custom class loader to flush
classes under test. Specifically, one app I'm involved with instruments
Java byte codes. I have a test suite that reloads the original class
file in the setUp() method and fiddles with its byte codes in testXXX().
Thus, each testXXX() method has a clean version of the class file
loaded by a custom (reloadable) class loader.

Mike
